basic_info.description: My name is Ryan Bagan and I am a Software Developer. I am a US NAVY Veteran and my previous experiences besides my military background includes Naval Force Protection Security with knowledge of armed response, anti-terrorism, combat arms, and I was also a radio jockey. I decided to become a Software Developer as I believe the future is here. I also wanted to make a difference and have a very meaningful career. Learning skills in JavaScript, HTML, CSS brought out my personality and enabled me to express myself on websites that I have created. It also made me feel that I stood out from the crowd, helped me understand and explore other programming languages, and contribute to projects better. I believe that my previous experience with teamwork, leadership, mentorship, large scale operations management, my commitment to deadlines, attention to detail, and work ethic is of great value and advantage that I can bring to my next company and my next job. Thank you very much and looking forward to being a part of your team.üëç

projects.title: SpaceMonkeys
projects.description: My first official team project at Code Fellows. It was a great opportunity to learn and work with aspiring software developers. I mostly contributed to the design of the app which you will see in the main page, about page, and credits page. It was grueling at most days of preparing and developing but it was worth the late nights.

projects.title: Tic Tac Toe
projects.description: Personal project that I created while I was on a 1 week break after my Code Fellows 201 course. I decided to create a small project just to keep my proficiency being a junior software developer. It was fun!

projects.title: Gallery of Horns
projects.description: My first lab assignment for Code Fellows 301 course. This was a very challenging lab. Just used my creativity is designing the page. Hope you guys will like it.
